oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Threaded iron bolt from a battlefield tree
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Belonging to Confederate veteran Simon Peter Driver, who served as a private in Co. B, 7th Tenn. Cav., this large, threaded screw is accompanied by a note written by Driver which says, "Bolt picked out of a 'wounded oak' at battlefield Harrisburg [Miss.]"; Harrisburg was a Mississippi engagement where Gen. Nathan B. Forrest's cavalry suffered a defeat.
